qas.question: How many doctors saw Frédéric by the 3rd of December?
What did Frédéric have trouble playing as a result of his growing illness?
What condition did Frédéric describe the piano that arrived to him through many dangerous obstacles?
What month did Chopin's piano arrive?
What did Chopin have a hard time getting delivered to Majorca?
What month did Chopin's Pleyel piano arrive in Majorca?
Who did Chopin send his Preludes to?

context: On <a3_0>3<a3_0/> <a4_0><a7_0>December<a7_0/><a4_0/>, Chopin complained about <a5_0>his bad health<a5_0/> and the incompetence of the doctors in Majorca: "<a0_0>Three<a0_0/> doctors have visited me ... The first said I was dead; the second said I was dying; and the third said I was about to die." He also had problems having <a6_0>his <a8_0>Pleyel<a8_0/> <a1_0>piano<a6_0/><a1_0/> sent to him. It finally arrived from Paris in December. Chopin wrote to Pleyel in January 1839: "I am sending you my Preludes [(Op. 28)]. I finished them on your little piano, which arrived in the <a2_0>best possible condition<a2_0/> in spite of the sea, the bad weather and the Palma customs." Chopin was also able to undertake work on his Ballade No. 2, Op. 38; two Polonaises, Op. 40; and the Scherzo No. 3, Op. 39.
